headline.main: Candidates Share Space With Issues Like Health Care and Marijuana Laws

docs.abstract: Voters in forty states cast ballots on wide array of initiatives and referendums; Oregon voters apparently defeat single health-care plan and labeling of genetically-altered foods; Nevada voters turn down marijuana legalization; Floridians approve ban on smoking in indoor workplaces and class size limitations; Mass voters move to abolish bilingual education (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Voters in 40 states weighed in on a wide array of citizen-backed ballot initiatives and referendums that sought fundamental changes in health care, drug policy, school programs and transportation. In Oregon, a plan to create a single statewide health plan for all residents appeared to be headed for resounding defeat. The proposal would have replaced almost all public and private health care programs and individual health insurance, at a cost to state taxpayers of $1.7 billion in the first year.

docs.abstract: Article on Suffolk County (NY) Legislature which, since its formation in 1970, has gained reputation for innovative and sometimes questionable bans on products and behaviors; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: IT'S on a coast, its sandy beaches are havens for the Hollywood set, and it tends to pass unusual laws that are seen as either ahead of the curve or out in left field, depending partly on whether others follow suit. It is Suffolk County, the California of the East.

headline.main: She's Got to Be a Macho Girl

docs.abstract: Article on role reversal in which teenage girls, whether influenced by effects of feminism or internalized images of sexually powerful women in popular culture, have become assertive and even aggressive toward boys; experts say girls not only do the calling but often initiate romantic and sexual activity; drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN BERNARD is 16, strapping, handsome, a hormonal hot pocket of a teenager. Guys like him were once every father's nightmare. No longer.
